reviews.review_msg: Don't recommend.

The lectures were very confusing and boring to listen to, he often went off on tangents that were unrelated to the course material and when he was talking about the material it was so slow that many students were sleeping. The assignment was decent and the exams weren't too difficult as long as you read the textbook.

Wanted an easy GPA-boosting elective and got one, I 100% recommend taking CRIM 101 with this guy. Midterm and final were online and you had a week to do them. Asides from tutorials, everything else is skippable. Packback is marked for completion, not contents, so as long as you write 200 words on anything and include a reference, you're chilling
Brian is pretty chill and tries to be relatable. His class didn't teach me much but he is funny. There are two exams both textbook-based and Packback assignments. Pretty easy class.

Brian is a good guy but he gets distracted in lectures. Seems like he is there to get his bills paid, not teach. His lectures are kind of boring and the slides don't help with the exams. You are graded on Packback responses, which are graded by the website, and two exams. These exams are open-book and you get a week to complete them. GPA booster.

midterm/final are online, lectures aren't mandatory and almost all my tutorials were online. Very nice prof probably too nice and TA's were nice/ helpful as well. If you need a bird course this is the one to take.

Lectures are cancelled often (two times this sem) and tests are very easy. Both midterms and finals were take home, all multiple choice, open book with no time limits. Attendance is not necessary as every test question is straight out of textbook. As long as you show up for tutorials and submit packback questions and answers you should be fine.

Brian is supper sweet and really knows his stuff. He had a tendency to cancel class. When we did have lectures I never really went because we never really got through much course material. This course has no papers and 2 online exams that you have a week to do. I took this as a GPA booster and it was great. Interesting class and super duper easy.

This class was very easy. If you need an easy breadth social science take crim 101 with Dr Kinney. There is no papers and the midterm and final are both online, open book and Kinney told us to do the tests with our friends. You do Packback which is like a reddit post, where you make a post and respond to two other posts. 10/10 basket weaving course
Teacher is really great and CUTE!

Lorinda was a great prof & really easy going & her lectures were actually interesting. My class was at the Harbour Centre so the class was small & she really encouraged class discussion, which was great. Exams were easy & final was not cumulative. Just go to class and study her notes and you will do fine.

The midterm was hard but the final was ridicously hard(all the side comments that didn't matter.. did not use anything from the text)! plus she made the final 3 weeks early( but you still have to go to class) and now we have a team presentation and paper due on the  last day of class. Avoid her if you can.. i will in the future!

Lorinda is a nice prof... but as a prof, not so great! She created too much work for a 1st year class and made assigments more complicated than they should be. Her midterm was pretty easy, but her final was HORRIBLE! Usually profs weigh the final mostly on the second half of the semester, but not in this case!

she was the worst prof. i have ever had. She is great person, but she is horrible prof. You have to complete 4 or 5(?) essays and  complicated multiple choices and true or false in just 2 hrs. It was horrible class.

I took this course online & really liked the way it was designed. Dorota was my TA & was very friendly & helpful. I felt like if I had any questions that she would be more than happy to answer them in a friendly, professional, and concise manner. She is a very fair marker (unlike many TAs who are on a power trip) & always gives lots of feedback.

Vienna is the first Prof to ever reach out when I was struggling. There are 100+ students in the class yet she noticed when I didn't submit an assignment. Without judgement, she contacted me individually to see if I was okay. Vienna isn't just a good teacher. She's also a good person.

This is a really easy distance class. There are recorded lectures, and open book (timed) quizzes each week that are super easy. Definitely read first before attemtping them though, because the quizzes are timed. Overall good class and Vienna was easy to message and very understanding. Couldn't have asked for a better prof during the pandemic!

Was really helpful over email. Tough online class with lots of components though. Even though it's online, you have a lot to do and the weekly quizzes are timed! The content is pretty easy, just a lot of memorizing. I probably should have taken the lecture version.

It was a very easy class. There's no mandatory lectures, but there were mandatory tutorials. Every tutorial had easy 5-MC quizzes, and each tutorial had a presentation made by a student in that tutorial. She very passionate on her teaching and connects with class, but is passive aggressive but also cuz my class cheated on the test in front of her.

When it comes to the study portion, the tests and quizzes are super duper easy. Just go over the slides. I didn't even read the textbook at all and still got 5/5 on my quizzes and got very high marks on my tests. Her as a professor, she gives good examples, very opinionated. If you want an easy A, take her. The TA I had was amazing as well.
Honestly the class wasn't engaged either becuase the lectures were just slides made word for word from the textbook readings. Only went to class for possible exam questions.

The course itself was not that difficult, but the prof is not the best out there. She keeps on talking about her family the entire class and always has favourites. If she likes you, then you are in the good but if doesn't like you she'll keep on picking on you. The course material is easy, just go through the textbook and the lecture slides.

TAKE HER. I only studied lecture slides which she posts before lecture. Attendance mattered for tutorials and we had 5 questions of multiple choice quiz each week but was easy since she gives the answers in lecture or was straight from her slides. In lecture she keeps you engaged by telling stories and hints on questions that will be on the exams.

Farzana is full of so much ego and calls out students for going to the bathroom. Her lectures are pretty straight forward and you really don't need to read the textbook, testing was based on the slides.
Don't listen to these new positive reviews, they were definitely made by this prof to help her hopeless score.

Farzana doesn't deserve the bad reviews, she's clear in her grading, sets you up for success, and uses a solid balance between leniency while pushing you to do the best. As long as you do the readings/attend regularly, you'll do good. As someone whos quite reserved, I always felt included in the discussions. Wish there was more mentimeters though!

I'm not too sure why she receives the hate she does, but Farzana is a very fun person, unlike other professors who seem robotic. She often connects the course content to her own experiences and I think that makes the course more enjoyable. Her CRIM101 course is also quite easy and you don't need to read the textbook in order to get a good mark.

I think she really tries her best she is a kind prof tbh I don't know why she got so much hate she sometimes does go off topic tho but that's nice some people expect the professors to be a robot and only talk about the course material they're humans also of course they will talk about their life and opinions sometimes i feel it brings you closer

before taking any of her classes, please read this. she is a rude person that has a insane ego trip every single lecture. her powerpoints seem like a 5th grader wrote them, and seem like she just wanted to make them as fast of possible without any regard to the learning of her students. she was definitely bullied in school and wants to return it.
Trump 2024

She was racist from the start. Always talking about her private and lashing out at students. She should get her license taken away. She is always late to class, yet when students arrive to class late, she yells at them. Doesn't respond to emails even emergency ones and always makes excuses for her incompetence
The whole class failed in CRIM 101. Don't recommend this instructor, I have no idea why she is even teaching.
Worst instructor i've ever met. I'm never going to take her courses ever again.

Teaching style reminds one of high-school professors with all the bad jokes and constant digression. Prepare to be bored during class and expect a lot of pointless assignments that are graded as if you are a psychic who can read her mind. 0/10 would not try again

Amazing prof! She is very helpful and is easy to talk to! I love her teaching style and I would take another course with her again in the future. You can tell she cares about her students and she makes the lecture very interesting (guest lectures etc).

I don't have enough good things to say about Hilary. She's clear, helpful, and so passionate. She has high expectations, but she helps you reach them every step of the way. I've relied on her mentorship even after the course ended. Take a class with her. You won't regret it.
Gives good feedback and marks fairly, overall great prof! If you keep up with the readings and go to her office hours, she's really helpful! Highly recommend.
AWESOME
Hilary is an amazing professor, she was really engaging, passionate about what she lectures about, and professional/inspirational and she's my girl

CRIM 101 was a great class. Im in health sciences, but she made it so that the concepts were easy to understand and related them to real life. Hillary is really nice and will go the extra mile for her students. Before exams she had extra office hours & she gave us helpful tips on writing before the essay was due. She's hot too...:)

I'm about to grad and have been to two diff institutions but def my fav proff. Helps she's super young, fast paced interactive lectures, super nice (gave us tim bits TWICE!) Made content relatable to real life, brought in guest speakers, had movies in class, but also was expected to read for each class, 2 exams and 1 paper so still academic. :)
great class. lots of reading, but it's interesting. very available. if you put in the work you'll do well.
Hilary is amazing!

Hilary is a great proff! She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. She made the class really interesting and engaging. Textbook is essential for this class. Final and midterm were also fair, you just need to put in the work and go over the textbook chapters.

I have Hilary for crim 101 and she's great. Ive never had a prof who cares so much about their students and wants them to do well. Id recommend her classes to everyone! She knows what she's talking about and is nice and funny too.

She is the BEST. I took intro to policing at Langara with her and she is the most incredible prof I've ever had. She makes the lectures so fun and she is trying to see things from the students' perspectives. Even though, I wasn't really into policing, I had really fun in her classes. She definitely grades everything so fairly.

I LOVE Val! Such a fun, caring, and funny prof. The TAs however were disorganized and took a while to mark our assignments. They sometimes gave poor feedback but would be helpful if you emailed them directly. Quizzes and final was online and open book so that helped with stress a ton. Lectures are not mandatory but were fun and helpful to go to.

Dr. Spicer is a great professor! If you read the textbook then you should be fine for the quizzes. There are 4 quizzes (each quiz is 4 chapters), 1 midterm paper & 1 final. Lots of reading and the TA's are not consistent in marking, so if you get a bad TA then gl! Tutorials are very boring and lectures are long but she lets us out early.
Although the lectures can be long without any breaks, they are good for clarification if you are struggling with anything. She is very passionate about crim and she really cares about her students.

Dr. Spicer really cares about her students and makes learning easier by putting quizzes and lectures online. You do have to study for quizzes and exams, but they are all open book. Super reasonable grader. The only struggle would be the term paper, but the TAs explain the term paper clearly. Overall, easy to understand the material.
Mandatory attendance for CRIM101 was only tutorials, good prof, PowerPoint slides in lectures are always helpful because sometimes we would learn 3 chapters a week.

Tutorials are not helpful at all, but participation and attendance are marked. She posts her lectures as slides online, so going to lectures is not really necessary. Quizzes are pretty easy, and everything is in the textbook. The term outline is worth 10%, so its worth doing well on it.
VAL IS A QUEEN.

I love val she's such a great prof. Her lectures are super easy to follow and she always makes them fun and interesting. You will always be laughing in her class. Tutorials are super helpful at times depending on your TA and the quizzes are pretty straight forward as long as you have been paying attention throughout the course.

Dr. Spicer is a fun lecturer but all her slides are already posted online which makes the lectures repetitive. The TAs can be pretty tough on everyone, so participation is key with tutorials. Ask lots of questions and its quiz heavy.

Extremely tough grader, wasnt clear in quizzes etc. Tbh I was really surprised about her high rating, she brags about how many people fail and isnt helpful. TAs DOESNT really help, its like 2020 shes trying to see how many students she can fail etc.

I'm sure this prof may be great in person but not online. Taking this class as a third year student just to fill up breadth I'd say this is not a good class for a first year student to take. Info on paper wasn't clear on APA 7. 3 quizzes on 4 CHs each and all of a sudden last quiz on 6 chapters but worth the same. TA's seemed to work against us...

The nicest prof I've ever seen! She really wants her students to have good grades, so her mt and final are based on her review slides. Textbook is needed for definition questions in the exams. She also allows students to write their exams on another day if they have 3 or more exams in the first week of the final. Very generous marking too!
Best prof I've ever had! Her class is so easy and she's very understanding. Take her class if ever possible!

Val was a really wonderful prof to have in my first semester at SFU! She was very clear and really simplified the material down to the important parts. DEFINITELY attend lectures as 10% of your mark is attendance and she also tells you what stuff will be on the exams. Very easy course that was also really interesting
Good prof, easygoing and brings  a lot of  knowledge to the class as she works in the VPD I believe.  Easy midterm, final was kinda tricky, but take CRIM 101 with Spicer over Cartwright if you can!

Lectures aren't mandatory though on some days there are clicker marks. She posts the slides online which helped a lot. She simplifies the context of the course into her own words by using her own situations as she works for the VPD and had multiple guest lecturers come in which was also very helpful. Would strongly recommend having her as a prof.

Val is a very easygoing prof, attending her lectures isn't necessary because she posts the lecture slides, but I would recommend attending anyway because she will literally tell you what will be on the exams and what you don't need to study

Val is a great Crim professor because she also works for the VPD. She's so great to learn from. There is a midterm, 1 term paper, and a final, so you have to do well on these because they compile your grade. Attendance isn't mandatory because she posts lecture slides, but she does an iClicker quiz every week which shows your attendance (worth 10%).

She's pretty chill, the only thing is she has these iclicker quizzes and they aren't even questions  about the syllabus, it's just like "are you wearing pink today?" it's like she just wants you to show up which is cute, I was high-key bored in the beginning of the sem but she grew on me!! She looks  like Ellen Degeneres! Lots of guest lectures!
Great prof to have ! Did an excellent job at keeping the class interesting.
Great teacher! had an amazing semester wth Greg he really opened my eyes and did not make the class boring ! Very fair and caring person !
he is the best prof.. Exams are fair and easy. If you study hard, you will do fine. i want to take another class w/  him !
he is A++++ prof. jst take the course w/ him.. his exams r fair. if u read the textbook u will do fine. =D
Crim 101 was my first crim course at sfu and i loved it. i think he is really, really great prof.His lecture is very organized and easy to follow. Besides, He really tries to help students.

He's a new prof and so many people were complaining about him.  I agree that his classes were fairly dry (but then again, I'm a Crim major so I already knew about the concepts) but his class was so easy!!!  He bases his lectures on the textbook and he is extremely approachable as well.  Could make class more interesting though.

Don't know what the last person is talking about. Greg's lectures were extremely clear and well delivered. He has a great ability to use examples to clarify abstract theories. His occasional elaborations beyond what was strictly required provided useful context. If you just want to be  mindlessly spoonfed for the exam, then go back to high school!

I absolutely hated this prof. He is still a graduate student, and had never taught a class before. He would ramble on and read his powerpoint notes and after everything he would say "but you don't need to know that"  The TA was just as useless. If you are going for this class, try and get in with Neil Boyd (the course creator) Greg is an airhead!!!

He is really great prof. I truly enjoyed his class and well-organized lecture. Tests were fair too. i love that he posts lecture notes on webct. i will take anothaer crim  class if he is the prof. of that class.

Love this guy. Lectures can be a touch boring but his sense of humour makes up for it. He told us not to eat during the exam because we would choke from anxiety and he wouldn't know how to save us lmao. Gives out exam Qs beforehand and they are easy. Start the paper early. He can go off on tangents for sure, but it's not really a bad thing.

Really nice professor. He doesn't want his students to be stressed out about the exams or the course in general. He offers all possible help, so it is up to you whether you take advantage of it! Lectures are grounded in his knowledge, and he provides plenty of examples to help you understand the context. More then enough for success! Recommended!

I don't get all the hate, his anecdotes are amusing and his accent is 50x better than some of the professors I've had here. Content and feature documentaries are fairly interesting, and the midterm was easy. Only studied the day before it and did fairly well, and the final was online as well. Start the 10pg term paper early and show up to tutorials
There are iclicker quizzes so you have to keep up with the readings. Jay made lecture really enjoyable though, he always kept it interesting & involved the class in discussions.
Great guy overall, I had him in first year and he really made me want to show up for class, study for his class and you'll get a good grade
Great class. Super informative & enthusiastic about the course and about teaching. Absolutely loved the class. A little unclear with test topics sometimes.
Jay is a really nice person and his lectures are interesting. He asks the class questions and keeps us engaged. Would recommend.
Hilarious prof who puts things in perspective. His classes are fun and helpful. Tests are pretty easy and NON CUMULATIVE.
Nice guy

Very good prof! Not a crim major and did perfectly fine in his class because he keeps it interesting. Must know the textbook inside and out for exams and iclicker questions in class. Test are mainly multiple choice and for written you have to be very detailed and specific to get the full marks! He makes you feel good about going to school :)

An interesting person with a definite knack for teaching at a university level. He is able to control the class really well, and explained things pretty clearly. Read the textbook really well for the exam.

Jay is a very enjoyable guy to take a class with. Lectures were always very interesting to go to, lots of fun stories told. Textbook is mandatory, you need to read the chapter (or 2) before class, not a heavy workload. Quiz during class to check if you actually read, and midterms are very fair, everything related to slides. All in all, very nice!

Jay is an enjoyable person, very entertaining and relates the course material by telling us personal stories as well as asking the class. He definitely kept the 3 hour lecture interesting (hey, he never even kept us the full 3 hours). First midterm was a breeze, since we did so well, he challenged us on the second.. hard. Fair exams. Good class.

Very entertaining prof, always kept the class lively and fun! I personally loved this class and the prof was great, would definitely take another class with him at SFU. Midterms are both quite easy. Keep up with readings, class is all textbook based. I'd recommend this class for sure.

I'm writing this in class because I honestly felt like expressing my insights for this class. She does not teach anything remotely close to what she puts on the mid terms, book is useless. I spent 4 days studying for this class knowing she's a hard marker, but stil class Average was 54%. With my mark slightly over the average. Do not take her at al

The worst class. It would have been interesting but Morden is unapproachable. I don't mind hard markers, but she's just unkind and really unhelpful with her feedback. There's a lot of shameless self promotion going on. I definitely do not recommend this instructor.
hard marker, too much expected from first year students
Funniest prof. Always there when you need help and wants you to do well.

Has very interesting lectures and engages students rather than watching her ramble off a powerpoint (don't expect those to be online). The exams and papers are TOUGH for a first-year course - requires lots of work, even marked tough... kind of a huge slap in the face for first years. Does provide help when asked for so you aren't running blindly.

so much regret taking this course. lectures are really boring textbook is not helpful, extremely stressful and painful to read. please don't ever take this course for your good. I should have dropped this course.

expects students to read one or two whole chapters of textbook in one week and there's a quiz on that every week. lectures are irrelevant to textbook which you'll be quizzed or tested on and makes rude jokes. avoid.

She expects you to work for your mark. If you aren't doing well, ask her why and suck it up... She'll tell you what to do. she treats her students likeep adults, which can be rough on first year students.

Hilary Morden is an absolutely amazing prof. I had her in my first year at SFU and I honestly go out of my way to recommend her to other Crim students. She has lots of experience in the field, and really knows her stuff. She's a tough marker and the exams are not easy, but even with that said, I would take a course with her again. Unparalleled.

I had her as a prof for CRIM 101 and she was great, her grading criteria was crystal clear, it was literally 2 pages of her telling us exactly what to do, there is no reason you should be lost. TAs are nit picky about answers on midterms an finals, you have to be spot on. Great prof, engaging, extremely passionate, would take another class with her

Hilary comes across as rude and tough at first but she did try to make lectures fun and engaging. She doesn't have tolerance for chatting during class time. Read and attend lectures for the weekly iClicker quizzes and you will be fine. The paper was marked relatively easy, and the exams were okay.

Hilary is the worst prof I have had at SFU in two years. Don't get me wrong, she is a very intelligent person and I genuinely think she could be a great prof but her attitude toward students, lack of clarity in what is expected, and overall disorganization in terms of administrative tasks is frustrating to say the least.

Her lectures are long and boring because she tends to get off topic really easily. She didn't give us enough time for our midterm (50 minutes for the essay), so more than half the class didn't complete that part. We also have an iClicker quiz at the end of every lecture. Overall, passing  isn't hard for this course, but you have to know your stuff.

Slides are not put up online.  Midterm mainly based on the textbook. I-clicker quiz at the end of every class, make sure to read additional supplementary articles. Midterm was difficult, given an hour to write an essay.  Short answers need to be very detailed and specific.  Final based on everything.  Gives extra bonus percentages.
An instructor who is informative but with a terrible attitude.

Did not like this prof. Wasnt hard, was just kind of rude. Also some of his tutorial activities are just completely ridiculous. Making students communicate without talking and then presenting in front of the class right after just doesnt make sense to me. If you dont like being put on the spot dont take his classes.

class consisted of a midterm, final exam, and paper along with tutorial participation/attendance. very straightforward midterm and final exam - memorize lecture slides including key concepts and terms and you're good to go! term paper was a little confusing at first, but not terrible. bonus marks are awarded for attendance + research

Great prof, gives hilarious and informative lectures. Carlos is very friendly and helpful. He provides lots of examples to help students understand the different topics in the class. Do the readings for tutorial as participation matters! His exams are fair and straightforward and as long as you understand the lecture topics you will be fine.

Participation matters so always show up! Otherwise pretty easy class if you can retain all the information and have it memorized then the midterm and final are a breeze. Be thorough and do memorize absolutely everything though. Grading criteria is easy enough to follow. Take this class seriously and it'll be a great gpa booster.

Great Professor, made lecture very interesting and easy to understand. Midterm and Final were easy as long as you listen to him in lectures. The term paper was slightly difficult, but on a very interesting subject which made it very fun to do.

He makes the classes pretty interesting, though tutorials can be a bit tedious. The midterm and final are pretty easy, although be prepared to memorize lots of terms and names. Beware of the term paper. It was more difficult than I expected.

looove my man carlos!! he made the material interesting by sharing personal stories. was relatable. talks alotttt about el salvador which was interesting but sometimes annoying because the material is based on canada so more examples about canada wouldve been more helpful when it came to studying for exams and stuff.
Great prof, easy class. A lot of key terms to know. Easy enough if you study. Midterm and final were simple.
I'm loving his course so far. Tutorials are entertaining and fun. His stories about crime in El Salvador are awesome. Still have to take the midterm.

I loved his class. Took it last semester. I actually came across his profile in ratemyprofessors when I googled his name to find out if he taught any other courses. He made boring material interesting. His examples about El Salvador where great.

Favourite Class this semester! Carlos is extremely passionate about the course and made boring topics interesting with stories about his past. His examples are memorable, and are useful because it helped me remember certain concepts during the exam

Great person, but teaching wise not so great. But I'll give him benefit of the doubt that it's his first time teaching. But his lectures are basically reading off the slides, along with unnecessary stories about El Salvador. In my opinion, just do the online tutorials and take good notes and you'll be fine. Paper and exams are easy though.

Carlos had many interesting stories about El Salvador and made dry content engaging during lectures. You still need to put an effort into graded work because he is a difficult marker. However, If you study the course material you will do great. Would love to take one of his classes again mainly because of his passionate personality!

Despite other reviews, I found him great! Midterm, final and the paper were all quite easy and straightforward with no surprises. The paper was also very interesting and taught me so much! I found his story intriguing and actually helped make the theories/concepts applicable as well as it taught me so much about crime in El-Salvador!

Carlos made it hard for me to want to come to class because all he did was talk about his El Salvadorian background. Don't get me wrong he had some interesting lectures but at the end of you day, you could make it by without coming to class. His slides are all over the place sometimes and he was very behind schedule to teach.

He's an okay prof but not a fair marker, he takes points off things that make no sense and his suggestions for the term paper did not help at all in attaining a high grade. He can be informative and his lectures have some good summary points, but I would not take his class again.

Been my favourite class this semester. Carlos makes lectures interesting, he's caring and really accessible outside of class, respond to emails well too. I would definitely love to have a class with him again in the future. He's passionate about what he teaches and makes dry content way more interesting to learn.

Carlos is a good person, but a bad prof. While he makes an effort to present the lecture material, he spends too much time trying to relate the content to his El Salvadoran background. Sometimes, he doesn't even know how to answer questions that students ask him. You learn everything from online tutorials. Take crim with Barry Cartwright instead!!
Not a bad teacher, just a hard class

Dr Andresen is a great prof, his lectures are super clear and easy to follow. Even though I took CRIM101 as an intersession course, so there was a lot of required reading in a really short time, his lectures and tutorial discussion questions made it simple to understand what I needed to know to pass his exams

I loved this class, the professor and the TAs were great. A lot of dad jokes were made. The course material was really interesting to me, but there was quite a bit of reading involved. Attendance is mandatory for tutorials, not for lectures.

Aidan is the TM for this class and does not respond to any posted questions. Says that specific material will be on the midterm and then it is not. There are mandatory tutorials and quizzes every week and the questions on quizzes and midterms are almost set up to trick you. Some Qs even are from CHs you have not done yet. DON'T take online version.

Barry's lectures are really dry, he tries t be funny but I never really understood his sense of humour. He's straight forward but quite robotic in my opinion, not passionate about the material. Study from his lecture notes and you should pass no problem.

Barry organizes the class material in a way that makes it look really simple, which I really appreciate. I also had him for CRIM104 online, and the format was the same. The online tutorials were super helpful and they were for marks (so do them!). Lectures weren't the most entertaining, but overall, I'd take a class with him again.

I disagree with the previous sentiments about humour. It's not suited for 18 year olds, it's suited for 12 year olds. Overall not very funny but I appreciate the effort to be interesting because his content is incredibly boring. All he does is copy and paste novels onto the lecture screen and reads it out to you. As a result: too much to remember.

Overall easy teacher, I would recommend taking the class with him. But he's not really helpful. I went in to talk to him about my midterm and all he did was guilt trip me saying i didn't read the book. I did, i read through every chapter. Also, I emailed him one week prior to the term paper to get it checked with him, he never replied my email.

Barry has a lame sense of humor. That being said it does keep the class fun so I do appreciate the effort. The content is relatively boring, but you do watch 2-3 movies which is nice a chill. I-clickers are required and pretty easy marks.
I simply love him. His class is so much fun. I like the way he makes it all look really simple. I love you Barry...

Yes, some of the other posters are right. His humor and attitude is more suited towards 18 year olds. So if you're older or more mature than that, good luck. Also seems to be a bit disorganized. Too many theories and really obscure stats. Would be more beneficial if he made clearer, comprehensive notes. The textbook is a borefest as well.

He thought he was funny, but he's not really. I didn't do any of the readings (textbook or otherwise), and still managed ok. He tests a lot based on tutorials and random obscure facts he mentions in passing in lectures. I found the midterm really hard, and I studied for like 2 weeks, but I studied the text. Lost interest in Criminology.
HE WAS AWESOME. HE SHOWED SOME FUNNY CLIPS DURING THE POWERPOINTS TO KEEP THE CLASS ENGAGED. LOVED HIS CORNY JOKES AND STORIES. MIDTERM AND FINAL WERE NOT TOO HARD IF YOU ATTENDED LECTURE.

If you are a serious student and not a first year child, do not take this course with this prof. He is unapproachable and seems to believe that his inappropriate yet pedestrian humour will suffice for a lesson plan.
I thought he was hilarious and his class was a great gps booster. You don't really need to read the text book because he goes over it really well in class

He is a funny prof. Class was always entertaining. Don't buy the textbook. His tests are based on his slides from lectures. Buy the course reader because a portion of your grade comes from tests based on this book. Overall it was an easy class.
Barry was super funny. I had him my first semester at SFU. Pretty easy class, didn't try to hard.. And his exams are based off his lecture slides. Just go to class, it'll be all good.

no neeed to buy the text book since he goes off of his lecture notes..too much material and memorizing for a first year class..there's a quiz every week so you must do the readings since that's how he marks you for tutorial/attendence which is 30% of you grade

Absolutely LOVED him. Textbooks are useless, EVERYTHING is based on his notes which he clearly describes all the material. Know all the terms given and he loves anything to do with Lists. Midterm and final are lengthy, but easy. Great prof! definitely taking him again.
Super easy class. Definately a GPA booster! You don't really even need to buy the text book. Just get the lecture notes and attend the review classes and you should do very well on the exams!

SUPER EASY AND FUNNY PROF! His marking is unbelievably easy - even on term paper. Gave 1% bonus bcuz MT avg was "only" 70%. Tutorial quizzes were easy, except for few which were tricky or were based on irrelevant details - but you dont need to read Boundaries book for exam bcuz the same questions show up on exam as multiple choice.

Very nice and pretty easy prof. Textbook was useless, tutorial book is needed however. Must attend all lectures to copy his notes, exams are basically straight from notes, with a section based on tutorial presentations.
The best prof there is right now for me! He is so easy and all his tests are straight from his notes. Do not buy the book, just buy the one required for tutorial!

The paper is not hard. His exams are easy, but does not reflect one's true understanding and will be hard if studied in the wrong direction. Ex: Lose a mark for not writing the authors' names when defining a theory; asking for the title of the video; and focus on statistical #s. My critical advise is PAY ATTENTION TO THOSE KIND OF STUFF!
Easiest class I have ever taken. The exams are verbatim from the notes. Course material is interesting and Barry is one of the most entertaining profs I have ever had :)
I think he's awesome! If you have need an easy GPA booster then GO FOR IT! He's hilarious and an easy prof!
What's with the constant necrophelia/anal probe jokes?  Good grief.  Is there a line of political correctness this has not crossed?
great professor, there is a textbook but it's not mandatory, all the quiz questions are in the powerpoint slides. Very funny, and has easy to understand and interesting lectures.

Logan was a great professor. The lectures were very engaging and he made the content very easy to understand. The quizzes and final are very fair and reflect what has been taught in the lectures. I would definitely recommend taking this class with Logan

Logan was a good professor as he was easy to understand and quite laidback. The class material was super interesting and even the TA was fun. If you want a good grade make sure you hand in all the written assignments on time as they are worth 40%, and make sure to study hard for the quizzes as they are worth 30% of your grade!

Logan is a great prof. Lectures are engaging and material taught is very interesting. If you have a love for criminology, and put in the effort on assignments, you will do well. No midterm, yet there are 2 tutorial quizzes and a final. TA's are fair markers and provide good feedback. Assignments are straightforward.

My first semester in university, and this class was the WORST ONE. I dont know who lied here, but he is not a good prof. His syllabus is unclear, there isn't much relevant information on what course policies are so this is what I've gathered: won't mark late assignments, won't provide feedback, must cite in class lecture powerpoints.

I had the joy of having Dr. Carleton as my professor on more than a few occasions. She always kept lectures interesting and was always more than willing to help during and outside of class. I enjoyed the fact that she focused more on large projects and papers instead of a plethora of small assignments. Will definitely miss her as my professor.

Dr. Carleton was truly inspiring and made criminology a tangible thing. She brought out the very best in me and encouraged me to achieve my potential. Her lectures were well prepared, informative and she always made the information clear and understandable. I would take another class with her without hesitation.
Funny and entertaining with a fairly easy class overall. If you read the textbook and show up to class a B is guaranteed.

good prof and very knowledgeable. inorder to do well in this class all you need to do is read the textbook carefully. all the questions on the exam is from the textbook if you dont read the textbook you will not do good.

Rebecca is really funny! Some things could be taken as offensive, because not everything is "P.C.", but it is meant as a joke. Some people need to lighten up. She is a good teacher and I like how she structures the class so the three hours seem more bearable. Her tests have a lot of questions but if you do the reading and show up you will pass.

Horrible prof. For a 3 hour lecture, all she makes is stupid jokes that arent funny. She treats everyone like we are children because of the assumption that we are all first years, and is coming short of calling first year students stupid. Checks attendance with iclicker and made it worth 25% of the grade.

The content is extremely dry for anyone who doesn't plan to become a crim major down the road. However, Rebecca tries her best to spice up lectures with jokes! Overall, exams are extremely fair and there is usually a freebie every exam. Very straightforward class.

Honestly, crim 101 with Rebecca is not really a GPA booster, her class is indeed funny, but the material is so dry that it's hard to stay awake for 3 hours.  She makes the exams progressively harder, and it is quite difficult to achieve an A.  I'd probably recommend the other crim 101 prof
one the easiest and funniest profs hands down! I've had high school teachers harder than this prof.

Honestly one of the best profs i've had so far. She's not only clear with her lectures, but she makes a 3 hour lecture worth while. Her exams are SO easy (multiple choice) ... literally read her slides before the exam and you will get 100%. I would recommend her class to anyone!

Extremely easy prof. People need to stop saying the prof is bad when they do poorly in a class. All her test questions are multiple choice. iclicker questions in lectures, but they are easy. I legit just read and write notes on the chapters 1 or 2 days before the test and I pull off a B-. With average effort an easy B can be achieve

Great Prof. Her examples are relevant and interesting. Exams are rather easy. Coming from a business student, this is a relatively easy course overall even if you are not going to major in crim. Would definetly recommend taking her classes

*Also teaches CRIM 104* Unorthodox teaching methods but she is one of the best profs there, she's really chill and makes sure to use examples that'll make the lesson more understandable.  Really fun prof that makes sure that her lecture is as lively as possible.
Informal teaching style. Doesn't provide anything online. Doesn't use her mic. Tests aren't even on the main concepts of the chapters covered.

I don't know what everyone is talking about saying how her midterms are crazy hard and how it brings your GPA down. Rebecca is so sick. She's the chillest prof I've had. For tests, she tells you what will be on it, and the best part is, is she makes notes for you to study...so the textbook isn't even necessary. Highly recommend..

THE COOLEST. Rebecca makes an effort to keep long lectures interesting. She has funny pictures on each slide and uses lots of examples to clarify concepts. She's very informal and outright hilarious, which makes the class atmosphere a lot more comfortable. Fairly easy and straightforward exams (MC), iclicker quizzes to bump up marks. Thumbs up!

Very funny, creative and personable. She knows her stuff, and is good at relaying information while being engaging, which can be hard in a 3 hour lecture! The exams are only multiple choice, which she made out to seem easy, but they are actually quite difficult. Unfortunately the worst marks out of all my classes.

She's an amazing prof! Lectures are 3 hours, which can be a little dry, but she keeps it interesting. She's funny and creative and very personable. The exams are only multiple choice, but surprisingly difficult. She made it sound like these would be easy, but I know a lot of people stuggle with them.

BEST PROF EVER!!! Her class is the only one I actually look forward to attending! She makes her lectures super interesting and funny and makes you remember everything. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND! TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU CAN!

Great teacher, really funny and amazing wit. She elaborates for all topics mentioned and makes sure we're interested in it too! Take her for Crim if u want it to be interesting and challenging (but in a good way).
She got her feelings hurt because someone wrote a mean comment about her so I thought I'd put this up saying how cool she is! My favourite class, and funny proff
super informal, but not that great of a prof. Midterms are KILLERS. If you're not a crim major, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. It will NOT bring up your average; most likely will drop it.
i love this prof! best crim prof ive ever had!

Tamie was my first prof and gave us a pretty good impression right away. She was very polite and understanding regarding the first-year students that started university during the peak of covid in 2020. She was also very clear about how the grading would work and provided generally helpful feedback.
She come across as condescending to her students. This annoyed me throughout the semester. There is a lot of participation requirement as well.

Tamie cares about her students a lot and give enough support for students. Weekly quizs are straight forward as long as you do readings and listen to the lecture. Midterm exam need you to understand the theories but it shouldn't be a problem. Get pepare on 10 pages final paper. Pay attention to the rubric and you will get a good grade.

Tamie is amazing! I had her last semester and she truly cares about her students well being and sets fair expectations. We had weekly quizzes, a midterm and a 10 page paper instead of a final. She also brought outside perspectives from people in the criminology field as part of the lecture sometimes, which I found super interesting.

The lectures are comprehensible and the professor is clear about her expectations. However, the TA and professor weren't on the same page which created more problems than necessary for a self-explanatory course. Engaging professor, and a mediocre TA.

Never met a prof that cares so much about her students. She's the sweetest person. Class should go well if you do the readings and take good notes in lectures. She's super clear about what she's looking for while also very inspiring. I highly recommend her for first year students, she also talks a lot about mental health and tries to help.

The TA and Prof had some discrepancies for sure, however as a 1st year myself, I did well in her class. You just have to take the initiative and attend lecture,read, etc to do well. I believe my classmates were just too upset that uni is harder than high school. The term paper was not that bad, and she's a very nice prof but is strict. TA was ok.

She's really kind and caring for her students. The only issue I have with the class is the instructions between her and her TAs, like everybody else. The instructions need to be more clear and they need to be on the same page. The term paper was a mess because instructions were not clear.

Dr. Fennig is really sweet, but she rambles a lot. The milestone draft and the final draft for the 10 page term paper was a mess because her requirements and the TA's requirements were FAR from similar. Her syllabus is not as "clear" as she constantly says it is. Her TA failed everybody who didn't follow HER expectations.

Super sweet, gives resources for mental health on day one. Gives outlines way ahead of time, and gives extra resources for projects. Great lectures, and is really caring about her students. has amazing guest speakers. makes you feel important and is honest about workload. gives tips thru out semester for studying and work

Sarah is a good teacher, but her classes were more discussion-based than theory, and in the exam, she demanded the theories we did not see in class. She gives a lot of work, but the papers are interesting, and there is a group project.

Her class requires a significant amount of reading each week along with weekly discussion posts and quizzes. The assignments are easy to understand and exams are fair, nothing is a surprise. She was very accommodating with COVID and did not want to cause too much stress.
Sarah is a kind teacher and cares about her students especially during these covid times. However, the lectures are boring. Her midterm and final are take home but it very time confusing.

Her exams are write 8 essays with in-text citations in 72 hours. I've spent two straight days on it and am still not finished. Even if you know the answers you have to go back and search deep into the text to properly cite it with page numbers. Lectures are boring and don't even cover most of the exam content. Get ready to read an ENTIRE textbook
Take home exams but they're very difficult. Too many instructions but also too broad for length in answers. Questions ask things she never covered and are hard if not impossible to find in the text.

We have a paper due tomorrow and her instructions are horrible and confusing. The topic has nothing to do with our lectures so we need to dig through the textbook for something relevant. She clearly has no consideration for our time or the fact that this isn't our only class OR THE FACT THAT THERES A PANDEMIC GOING ON AND WE ARE ALL VERY STRESSED!!

never hated a prof more. She has made learning during COVID so much harder than it should be. Her lectures are so boring and don't even give the information you need. Not to mention the endless distractions from her pets even tho it's prerecorded and she could easily edit it out but she's clearly too lazy. She has made this a horrible experience

Worst prof of my first year. Her lectures are very boring and not specific. She makes you teach yourself by reading the textbook. She never gave clear criteria regarding her assignments. Especially given the COVID circumstance, she did not try to accommodate and instead made everything more difficult. I would highly suggest avoiding her classes.

Worst prof I had during my first year. She made learning at home during COVID exceptionally hard. Did not give clear criteria for papers, quizzes, etc. and expected us to just figure it out. Quizzes were marked way too hard for an intro class and she gives a lot of 0s. Her lectures are unclear and tedious. Avoid this class at all costs.

Sarah was understanding of student struggles during the pandemic, often cancelling quizzes to allow us for more time complete more important assignments. She gives clear grading criteria and if you complete all the readings/lectures, you can get an A+. Make sure to note page numbers for info found in the textbook, as you'll need it for the exams.

Very unfair and harsh at marking papers for first year course,lectures boring from the book. The good things is that he brings guest speakers.If you want a "solider teacher" take him because he is very strict. I think students should have some say of lecture because we pay tuition, but he refuses to give power point lecture slides. Inconsiderate
Very helpful prof! Gives you plenty of time to copy down her very comprehensive notes, and marking is very fair.

Easily my favourite prof I've had so far. Gives you time to write down notes fully, decently easy content, tells you the written question for the final ahead of time. Also when I couldn't get into CRIM classes this semester she talked to the department about opening classes for us. Super nice and glad I have her for 104 this semester again.

She's an awesome prof. The material is boring, but she really does do a good job with it. It's an easy class if you do your work. I went over notes after each lecture and i reviewed the txtbk a week before exams and thats how i did well.the exams are based off the txtbk and lecture, but its pretty easy. she bascially tells you whats on the exams.

She's an awesome prof. This is not a hard class at all! Just keep up with the readings and pay attention in class. Don't make the same mistake I did... which was YOLOing the exams/term papers and screwing around every class which resulted with a C when i could of done so much better.

Definitely read the textbook but only focus on memorizing the definitions when studying for tests. Focus your time on studying her notes. They are really clear, helpful and useful for studying for tests. If your not willing to put time in to study and learn the material you wont do well, but if you do you should have nothing to worry about.

She`s a great professor! She geniunely cares about the students and is extremely helpful. Not only were her lectures clear, she is also a very outgoing individual. The text book, Criminal Event, wasn`t really mandatory to read since her lectures are based upon the readings. Overall, love her class!

She truly cares for everyone of her students and tries to make sure everyone succeeds. If you talk during her lectures she gets very frustrated and sometimes yells :/ the class isnt overly hard but isnt easy either. you really do need to study! She keeps lectures interesting and fun but still to the point

She is nowhere near the easiness every poster makes her out to be. However she is nice but her TAs can be unforgiving. If you think she is an easy prof you are dead wrong. But she does care for each student.

She is not as easy as the other raters make her seem. You still need to work hard and study in order to do well. Midterm and final was very straightforward, you either understand the material or you dont. I didn't like how she wouldn't post the full notes on webct though. Other than that she was a good prof for an intro criminology course

Her exams are easy enough if you keep up with the readings and listen in lecture. It's pretty straight forward; it's either you know it or you don't...nothing tricky. The lectures were engaging and the material was interesting. She's pretty funny and easy going. Very nice and always willing to listen to students :)

For CRIM 101 with Adrienne, all you have to do is study the midterm review notes/final exam review notes she gives you the week before the test and you'll do fine. She's easy and helpful. Only thing I don't like about her is that she doesn't post the full notes after class on WebCT
great prof, hot
Great Prof. Always available for help and can clarify any confusion that you have. Final is not cumulative which is nice. Pretty easy going as well. Take this class wit her if possible!

Adrienne Peters is a great professor. She is very passionate about what she does. She is a fair marker and always listens to the students opinions. She is extremely clear when telling you what to expect on the exam. I would definitely recommend taking Crim 101 with her.

She is nice, pretty easy going, classes can be boring if your not interested in Crim though, especially seeing how they are 3 hours with only a 10min break. Her midterm and final are not cumulative which is a bonus.
She's really engaged with the class and she's quite clear in her teachings.

Very nice prof. Taking CRIM 101 with her this year and it is boring, but, even so, she does her best to teach and she's usually quite clear, but, she can make it hard too. But, overall a good looking and good teaching professor. :)

3 hour lecture on fridays..... She always thinks she is right, and makes obvious mistakes in lecture. May be a lack of experience, but overall, not a pleasant course. She told me at the end: "People think that this is an easy course, but its actually difficult". Science major, put more time into this course than calculus. Disapointing
Don't take her class. Period.
She is so horrible. Her course content sucks. Her class average is so low that i wonder if she is a sadist and likes to inflict pain on her students. Dont take her class mates!

The whole lecture is useless if you don't take notes.  The exams are based completely on the lecture notes. This is supposed to be a good news! But when you see 10+ pages per lecture, you will not think so. The exam grade is also weird, when you think you will get 70%80% accuracy based on your memory of the lecture notes, you actually get 5060%.

Jordana has 3 hour lectures. In each class there are 10 questions that make up a quiz which are asked throughout the class so students stay. She is very straighforward the tests are also easy. However she's a hard marker. You might finish a Test thinking you got an b+ or A but you will end up getting a c or c+.
Takes quiz before explaining. Sometimes I don't get the readings but proffessor doesn't explain.
Very bad professor.

The worst class I have been to.  She basically reads off her slides and the slides are just points from the book that a 7th grader can make. You would learn so much more if you bought the book and just read it yourself.  I don't know why this woman is a professor. She can turn any good course into a boring one. Credits for that.

Straightforward expectations and easy enough to understand. Not the most experienced prof, but if you ask for clarification, she'll give it to you.  Lectures aren't recorded so you better go to class or make friends.

Nick is a really sweet guy and is super willing to help if you go see him. His tests are definitely on the tricky side but if you attend lectures and take notes you will do fine. The term paper was very straightforward and simple. Definitely would recommend him!

His lectures are to the point and interesting. You need to go to the lectures in order to get all of the notes. His midterm and final include points from his lectures, the tutorials, and the textbook. The online tutorials are helpful, be sure to do them and to pay attention during them.

Great prof! His class was interesting and the all the information needed for the midterm and final were provided clearly in class but aren't posted online so attending class is important. He answers questions fast & is always checking to make sure everyone understands the material. Would definitely take a class with him again!

Nick is an awesome prof! He is funny, and usually adds funny pictures to the slides which can make the material interesting. He will give feedback on term paper if you reach out to him. The online tutorials were straightforward. I wish I could have him as my prof for every class, and would definitely take a class with him if given the chance.

Nick is a great prof. His powerpoints are full of information, make sure to go to every single lecture. He asks a lot of questions during the lecture to make sure everyone is understanding the material. A pretty easy course, only if you put in the effort!

This prof did not know what was going on in the class she taught.. she didn't know certain dates or when our exam would be, but it was on the SFU site. Showed many youtube videos, then quizzed on the videos rather than actually teaching. This class itself was easy, but get ready, this prof makes it hard to understand simple topics, and yaps a lot.

I didn't take Dawn for any crim classes but she was my field placement coordinator and she was the most supportive, caring, and helpful faculty member I've ever interacted with at SFU. She truly is a blessing during a process so anxiety inducing and intimidating. If you're considering taking field placement know that Dawn has your back!
the grading criteria is very unclear. like who curves down bro

I have nothing but good things to say. The class was taught well, never too much information at once IMO. The textbook is free and the chapters are not too long. Tutorial grades are released every week so you know where you stand. Grading is fair and midterms/finals are exactly what she said they would be. If you put in effort, you will be fine.

Dawn has good lectures but do take notes. Read the textbook and take notes but chapters aren't long so its not that bad. Exams aren't too bad if you keep up with the material. Written questions have a pretty specific grading criteria so be careful of that. Tutorial material will also be on exams but its not hard stuff. Course itself is not hard.

Dawn is a great professor. The lectures were content heavy and you definitely needed to show up but the lectures were actually interesting. Easy material to study. The textbook was annoying accessibility wise but it was free and not terribly long per chapter. Perfect elective or GPA booster for sure.

One of the better profs, top 3 for sure. Super clear, super organized, taught the material really well. If u pay attention to lecture and the readings, you can easily score pretty high. Midterm is exactly what she said would be. Her lectures are aligned w the textbook chapters so it's pretty easy to catch up if you missed anything.Textbook is FREE!

Dr. Rault was an interesting lecturer who had well-laid out lectures and clear rubrics. We had one reflection, one midterm, one paper, and one final exam. The participation in tutorials are important, but the lectures are recorded, so attendance isn't necessary. Also used an open access textbook, so we didn't have to pay. Highly recommend.
